page.title: 13Arts and Crafts
page.content: In 1977 a husband and wife-American and Swedish-partnership of glass designers/blowers set up a studio in the disused Lindean corn mill using techniques gained mainly in Sweden.The high quality of their skills was quickly recognised by the acceptance of exhibits for display in museums and galleries in Britain and Scandinavia and by contracts with stores as far afield as London,Japan and U.S.A.where 40% of their products are sold.Another husband and wife team of painters in water colour,with a particular interest in plants and natural history has established a reputation for pictorial studies of prestigious houses with borders of local wild flowers-"personalised weeds".A local farmworker is recognised as a master craftsman in the decoration of shepherds' crooks.
